etymology.description: Depicts 禾(禾) (hé, "cereal") with 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") under it -> symbolizing millet with wine or its sticky nature
etymology.interpretation: The character 黍(黍) (shǔ, "glutinous millet") visually combines the image of a cereal plant with droplets or signs of water beneath it, likely indicating the wine made from millet or its water-resistant qualities. Alternatively, it highlights millet's unique growing conditions.

examples.chinese: 秋天时(秋天時)，农夫收获黍(農夫收穫黍)。
examples.english: In autumn, the farmer harvests glutinous millet.

examples.chinese: 古人以黍(古人以黍)，寓意丰收(寓意豐收)。
examples.english: The ancients used glutinous millet to symbolize a bountiful harvest.
